column4: This is my first time trying to install ubuntu on my 2nd box and it goes to the loading screen and does all those [OK] 's then it loads a rectangular box that says Ubuntu and shows Windom Manager, then it disapears and I see 2 white bars on the top and bottom part of the screen with a brown background but nothing happens...... Any suggestions/Ideas what this means i really wanna try out Ubuntu ;\
the CD Drive keeps blinking but doesnt seem like anything happens....
whats the minimum memory for Ubuntu?
oh i guess thats my issue, I'm running 128MB DDR PC3200, I was thinking thats enough, I can run windows Xp profession on that but not ubuntu? ;\
i would think xp pro would require more memory then ubuntu
i guess i have to steal another stick from my 3rd box
lol
i never listen to 'minumum requirements' :P
and didnt think twice cause xp pro runs on it
installer, not the system itself.
since it's a liveCD, it requires more memory, to not be reading from the CD (read: slow) all the time
which is why the alternate ISO requires signifigantly less
just get the alternate ISO ;)
no, it's not.  It just doesn't have a pretty interface
yep
how did you install it?
did you select the oem mode? or what?
heh, oem is for people distributing the computer, it leaves all the user config stuff until afterwards.  You actually don't have your first user set up yet, just an 'oem' user
login with your user (oem/whatever password), open a terminal do: sudo oem-config-prepare, then reboot
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Ubuntu_OEM_Installer_Overview
why do you feel the need to do that?
so, instlal kubuntu then ;)  you can actually have them both on the same system, no problem (assuming you have teh HD space)
